creator: grayconstruct
title: LED Blinky Wire Sculpture
materials_required: Stiff 18 gauge and 20 gauge wire (floral stem wire)
description: This project involves creating a wire sculpture with blinking LEDs. It utilizes basic electronic components to create a circuit that makes the LEDs blink at different rates, adding an interesting visual effect to the sculpture.
steps: Pick a design for the sculpture and create the wire mesh using stiff wire. Bend the wire to form the desired shape, incorporating symmetrical elements as needed.
Finish the wire mesh by removing any sharp or poking ends using pliers. Wrap the ends tightly around other wires or curl them into small loops.

Build a blinky circuit using the NE555 timer IC to create an on/off pattern for the LEDs. If desired, use a SN74LS163 binary counter to make different LEDs blink at different rates. Consider using a 5V regulator or USB phone charger if the binary counter is used.

Attach the LEDs to the sculpture by soldering a wire to the anode (+) of each LED and wrapping the cathode (-) around the conductive sculpture wire. Use heat shrink tubing to insulate the anode connection.

Plug the LED wires and ground wire into a solderless breadboard to complete the circuit. Attach the battery to power the circuit. Consider using a diode to prevent damage from reversed battery connections.
